Ordering information

Sold only to professional users.

Please read the material safety data sheet (MSDS).

Safety Data Sheet 45821_SDS.pdf

Safety Information

GHS07-1

Exclamation Mark

Signal word: Warning

H302: Harmful if swallowed.

H351: Suspected of causing cancer.

P201: Obtain special instructions before use.

P202: Do not handle until all safety precautions have been read and understood.

P264: Wash thoroughly after handling.

P270: Do not eat, drink or smoke when using this product.

P281: Use personal protective equipment as required.

Handling and Warnings

Contains cobalt. Water-based paint should be used immediately after mixing.

No ACMI Certification Seals available.

Warnings

WARNING: Exercise care when using dry pigments. Do not eat, drink or smoke. Avoid breathing dust. Use a NIOSH-certified dust respirator. Wash hands immediately after use. If creation of dust is likely, wear protective clothing.

Precautions

Keep out of reach of children.

The brilliant Cobalt Violet light is a PV 14 and contains cobalt. Depending on the temperature during production, the hue of cobalt phosphate varies from more reddish to more violet. This cobalt violet is the clearest available, transparent light violet. It is similar to our discontinued Cobalt Violet (#45820), but the pigment is slightly more granular.

The pigment is suitable for watercolor, but should be used immediately after mixing the paint. Cobalt violet also works well in tempera and in almost all acrylic dispersions, except Dispersion K 9 (#75367). We do not recommend this cobalt violet for oil paints due to its extremely slow drying.

Downloads

Details 45821e.pdf

Chemical description: Pigment Violet 14, C.I. 77360

Lightfastness - thinned: 8 (1 is bad, 8 is best)

Lightfastness - medium: 8 (1 is bad, 8 is best)

Lightfastness - concentrated: 8 (1 is bad, 8 is best)

ColorIndex: PV 14.77360

Opacity: transparent

Suitability: Acrylics, Tempera, Watercolor / Gouache

Colors: Violet

Forms: powder

Solubility in water: practically insoluble

For which application / techniques is Cobalt Violet, light suitable?

Cobalt Violet, light is suitable for Acrylics, Tempera, Watercolor / Gouache

What color has Cobalt Violet, light?

Cobalt Violet, light has the color Violet.

What Colorindex has Cobalt Violet, light?

Cobalt Violet, light has the Colorindex PV 14.77360.

How lightfast is Cobalt Violet, light?

Cobalt Violet, light has the lightfastness thinned = 8, medium = 8, concentrated = 8 (1 is bad, 8 is best).
